beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Farmer's Daughter? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Farmer's Daughter scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Farmer's Daughter. New York. 65 mi. NY rolling gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Start and finish at 182 Hudson Place in Chatham keeps it simple, with motorcycle support providing spare tires throughout the course. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Distance varies by source (62-68 miles) but consistently lands in gravel's sweet spot. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Experience. 3 out of 5. The experience justifies the entry fee. All finishers 21+ get Farmer's Daughter Rye IPA pint, full meal, Belgian beer glass, custom bike name plate, and hat. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Event draws 482-1200 riders depending on year, with strong local charity support for Columbia Land Conservancy and Crellin Park Pump Track. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Substantial finish line package includes custom beer glass, bike name plate, hat, full meal, and local brewery IPA for finishers 21+. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Mix of gravel roads, pavement, and technical singletrack creates bottlenecks. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. 6,000-7,000 feet of climbing over 65 miles with grades hitting 20%.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

Power output normal.
